trans-unit.source: Create a Trading Partner Agreement in Microsoft Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Create a Trading Partner Agreement in Microsoft Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Create Trading Partner Agreements
trans-unit.target: Create Trading Partner Agreements

trans-unit.source: Creating a Trading Partner Agreement
trans-unit.target: Creating a Trading Partner Agreement

trans-unit.source: Trading partners are the entities involved in B2B (Business-to-Business) communications.
trans-unit.target: Trading partners are the entities involved in B2B (Business-to-Business) communications.

trans-unit.source: When two partners establish a relationship, this is referred to as an *Agreement*.
trans-unit.target: When two partners establish a relationship, this is referred to as an *Agreement*.

trans-unit.source: The agreement defined is based on the communication the two partners wish to achieve and is protocol or transport specific.
trans-unit.target: The agreement defined is based on the communication the two partners wish to achieve and is protocol or transport specific.

trans-unit.source: The various B2B protocols and transports supported Azure App Service include:
trans-unit.target: The various B2B protocols and transports supported Azure App Service include:

trans-unit.source: AS2 (Applicability Statement 2)
trans-unit.target: AS2 (Applicability Statement 2)

trans-unit.source: EDIFACT (United Nations/Electronic Data Interchange For Administration, Commerce and Transport (UN/EDIFACT))
trans-unit.target: EDIFACT (United Nations/Electronic Data Interchange For Administration, Commerce and Transport (UN/EDIFACT))

trans-unit.source: X12 (ASC X12)
trans-unit.target: X12 (ASC X12)

trans-unit.source: BizTalk API Apps that support B2B scenarios
trans-unit.target: BizTalk API Apps that support B2B scenarios

trans-unit.source: The following API Apps enable these capabilities using a rich and intuitive experience in the Azure Portal:
trans-unit.target: The following API Apps enable these capabilities using a rich and intuitive experience in the Azure Portal:

trans-unit.source: BizTalk Trading Partner Management (TPM)
trans-unit.target: BizTalk Trading Partner Management (TPM)

trans-unit.source: Create and management of Partners, Profiles & Identities
trans-unit.target: Create and management of Partners, Profiles & Identities

trans-unit.source: Storage and management of EDI Schemas
trans-unit.target: Storage and management of EDI Schemas

trans-unit.source: Storage and management of certificates (used in AS2 protocol)
trans-unit.target: Storage and management of certificates (used in AS2 protocol)

trans-unit.source: Creation and management of AS2 Agreements
trans-unit.target: Creation and management of AS2 Agreements

trans-unit.source: Creation and management of EDIFACT Agreements (includes batching on the send side)
trans-unit.target: Creation and management of EDIFACT Agreements (includes batching on the send side)

trans-unit.source: Creation and management of X12 Agreements (includes batching on the send side)
trans-unit.target: Creation and management of X12 Agreements (includes batching on the send side)

trans-unit.source: AS2 Connector
trans-unit.target: AS2 Connector

trans-unit.source: Executes AS2 Agreements as defined in the related TPM API App instance
trans-unit.target: Executes AS2 Agreements as defined in the related TPM API App instance

trans-unit.source: Surfaces AS2 processing/tracking information for troubleshooting
trans-unit.target: Surfaces AS2 processing/tracking information for troubleshooting

trans-unit.source: BizTalk EDIFACT
trans-unit.target: BizTalk EDIFACT

trans-unit.source: Executes EDIFACT Agreements as defined in the related TPM API App instance
trans-unit.target: Executes EDIFACT Agreements as defined in the related TPM API App instance

trans-unit.source: Surfaces EDIFACT processing/tracking information for troubleshooting
trans-unit.target: Surfaces EDIFACT processing/tracking information for troubleshooting

trans-unit.source: Provides state management of batches (start and stop) as defined in EDIFACT Agreement(s) in the related TPM API App instance
trans-unit.target: Provides state management of batches (start and stop) as defined in EDIFACT Agreement(s) in the related TPM API App instance

trans-unit.source: BizTalk X12
trans-unit.target: BizTalk X12

trans-unit.source: Executes X12 Agreements as defined in the related TPM API App instance
trans-unit.target: Executes X12 Agreements as defined in the related TPM API App instance

trans-unit.source: Surfaces X12 processing/tracking information for troubleshooting
trans-unit.target: Surfaces X12 processing/tracking information for troubleshooting

trans-unit.source: Provides state management of batches (start and stop) as defined in X12 Agreement(s) in the related TPM API App instance
trans-unit.target: Provides state management of batches (start and stop) as defined in X12 Agreement(s) in the related TPM API App instance

trans-unit.source: As previously stated, the AS2, X12, and EDIFACT API Apps require a TPM API App to function as expected.
trans-unit.target: As previously stated, the AS2, X12, and EDIFACT API Apps require a TPM API App to function as expected.

trans-unit.source: Getting Started
trans-unit.target: Getting Started

trans-unit.source: To create trading partner agreements:
trans-unit.target: To create trading partner agreements:

trans-unit.source: Create an instance of the **BizTalk Trading Partner Management** connector.
trans-unit.target: Create an instance of the **BizTalk Trading Partner Management** connector.

trans-unit.source: This requires a blank SQL Database to function.
trans-unit.target: This requires a blank SQL Database to function.

trans-unit.source: Before starting be sure to have a blank database available and ready for use.
trans-unit.target: Before starting be sure to have a blank database available and ready for use.

trans-unit.source: Upload schemas and certificates as required by the agreements.
trans-unit.target: Upload schemas and certificates as required by the agreements.

trans-unit.source: This is to be done by browsing the TPM instance created and stepping into the ‘Schemas’ and/or ‘Certificates’ part
trans-unit.target: This is to be done by browsing the TPM instance created and stepping into the ‘Schemas’ and/or ‘Certificates’ part

trans-unit.source: Browse to the TPM instance created and step into the **Partners** part
trans-unit.target: Browse to the TPM instance created and step into the **Partners** part

trans-unit.source: Create partners as desired.
trans-unit.target: Create partners as desired.

trans-unit.source: Also edit the profile(s) as appropriate and add the required identities
trans-unit.target: Also edit the profile(s) as appropriate and add the required identities

trans-unit.source: Now use the **Agreements** part to create agreements.
trans-unit.target: Now use the **Agreements** part to create agreements.

trans-unit.source: During agreement creation one of the initial steps is to choose the protocol.
trans-unit.target: During agreement creation one of the initial steps is to choose the protocol.

trans-unit.source: Based on the protocol chosen the rest of the agreement configuration takes place.
trans-unit.target: Based on the protocol chosen the rest of the agreement configuration takes place.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
